definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: There are difficulties, but being defeatist can't help.
sentences.chinese: 困难总会有，但是认输气馁却于事无补。

sentences.english: Don't let first failure discweage you, try first abundance time.
sentences.chinese: 无所不能因该一次失败就气馁，再试一试看。

sentences.english: You should not give up though you failed the exam. All roads lead to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 即使你考试失败，也不要气馁，条条大路通罗马。

sentences.english: E. g. Don't became dejected. Courage is the father of success.
sentences.chinese: 不要气馁，勇气是成功之父。

sentences.english: Never down, go ahead , cuz time never stops.
sentences.chinese: 不要气馁，勇往向前，因为时间从未停止过前进。

sentences.english: Mother was discouraged by the trouble that impended.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈因为将要到来的麻烦而气馁。

sentences.english: Refusing to be discouraged, Christopher took a few more breaths the next day.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯托弗毫不气馁，第二天又多呼吸了几次。

sentences.english: There"s no reason to feel discouraged.
The clear message that they might keep only half of the profit from their ideas daunted inventors.
sentences.chinese: 投资人由于只能从其创新中获得一半利润而感到气馁。

sentences.english: However, Margo believes that couples shouldn't despair.
sentences.chinese: 然而，玛戈认为夫妻双方不应气馁。
但是爱德华兹并不气馁。

sentences.english: Bad credit can dishearten you in many ways .
sentences.chinese: 不良信贷可以气馁，你在许多方面。

sentences.english: Sometimes, the narrowminded people make me frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 胸怀狭小的人，有时使我气馁。

sentences.english: Instead of being crestfallen, he was busily engaged in planning new activities.
sentences.chinese: 他没有气馁，反而忙碌地计划新行动。

definition: to leak (gas)/to be discouraged/to despair/(disparaging) pathetic/to vent one's anger/(of a tire) to be flat
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to slacken off/to take it easy
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
